properties.Name: 21 Acres Farm
properties.description: 21 Acres Farm is located just outside of Woodinville. It is the northern most property of the Sammamish Agriculture Production District located at the 21 Acres Center for Local Food and Sustainable Living. 21 Acres serves as a convenient aggregation site for Farmstand Local Foods' nearby farmers.

properties.Name: Agrarian Society
properties.description: Agrarian Society is a small farm in the Sammamish valley of Redmond, we have been farming this land for the past 16 years. Our practices are Salmon Safe; we farm with organic methods without certification. All our plants are started in our green houses and we source organic and non-GMO seeds for our crops.

properties.Name: Bow Hill Blueberries
properties.description: Established in 1947, our family farm is proud to be the first blueberry farm in Skagit Valley. We specialize in heirloom varieties. We offer you-pick and we-pick and are dedicated to providing a fun, safe, community oriented place to pick blueberries.

properties.Name: Caruso Farm
Cherry Valley Dairy
properties.description: Cherry Valley Dairy is a farmstead creamery located in Duvall, WA - the heart of the Snoqualmie River Valley. The small team at CVD crafts fine butter and cheese from the rich milk of Jersey cows. Their products reflect the seasons in the Valley and high quality of milk. Their girls graze on lush pasture from April through October and are spoiled with Alfalfa and Orchard grass in the winter.

properties.Name: Flying Tomato Farm
properties.description: We are husband and wife farm operators who live and work on 10 acres between Snohomish and Monroe. Since 2005 we have been growing thousands of plants and dozens of varieties beefsteak and cherry tomatoes for sale at farmers markets around Snohomish and King counties. We focus on tomatoes and cucumbers but also produce limited supplies of eggs, herbs and goat milk soap.

properties.Name: Goose and Gander Farm
properties.description: Goose and Gander Farm is a six-acre diversified farm in Washington's beautiful Snoqualmie River Valley. We offer seasonal produce, eggs, honey & flowers. We are dedicated to growing delicious produce, grown responsibly for our land and community. We love to grow food, and we love to cook, eat, and share that food with you! Goose and Gander Farm serves as an aggregation site  for Farmstand Local Foods so that nearby farms have a convenient drop spot for their sold items.

properties.Name: Lettuce Love Farm
properties.description: Lettuce Love Farm aims to produce sustainably grown diversified vegetables, pastured eggs, and microgreens and to support social, environmental, and economic justice through agriculture.

properties.Name: Lost Peacock Creamery
properties.description: Lost Peacock Creamery is a Grade A Goat Dairy in Olympia, Washington. We are conscious of how our presence impacts the environment and we’re proud to be a Thurston County Green Business. We milk 36 goats once a day and make cheese every other day. Our power comes from alternative energy sources and we utilize our whey by-products to feed our pigs. We are committed to creating an environment that sustains us without sacrificing the land and are a certified Animal Welfare Approved farm.

properties.Name: Mezza Luna Farm
properties.description: At Mezza Luna Farms we grow everything ourselves. We use organic, non GMO seed sources and organic fertilizers and compost. We are dedicated to sustainable growing methods and do not use pesticides or herbicides.

properties.Name: Nash's Organic Produce
properties.description: Nash’s Organic Produce is located in the Sequim-Dungeness Valley on the fertile delta of the Dungeness River on the North Olympic Peninsula in Washington State. Surrounded by water on three sides and the spectacular Olympic Mountains to the south, the North Olympic Peninsula has a unique, moderate climate that enables Nash Huber and his team of young farmers to produce the finest organic fruits, vegetables, grains, seed, eggs and pork year ’round. You can purchase Nash's wholesale grains and flours through Farmstand Local Foods.

properties.Name: Orange Star Farm
properties.description: At Orange Star Farm we grow great tasting, beautiful specialty fruits, vegetables, herbs and edible flowers as well as raise ducks on pasture for incredibly rich duck eggs. We are a sustainable small farm growing unique varieties with minimal environmental impact and strive for maximum flavor, nutrients and beauty.

properties.Name: SAgE Sammamish Valley Student Farm
properties.description: We are a non-profit that teaches new farmers about food production methods and food system models for sustainable bioregions through an ecological approach to small–scale agriculture. We teach the importance of analyzing and evaluating the cultural, political, and economic dynamics that influence the sustainability of food systems. The mission of the SAgE Collaborative is to increase access to education about sustainable practices in growing food and to prepare students for careers in agriculture and related environmental fields.

properties.Name: Sauk Farm LLC
properties.description: Sauk Farm is a family farm first and foremost. The Berger family has been farming in the foothills of the cascades for over ten years at the base of Sauk Mountain. Our isolated location in the Sauk River Valley makes the farm a pristine location for organic farming practices. We believe that good stewardship of the land is critical to producing high quality nutrient dense fruit. We are committed to producing organic crops in a sustainable manner that has the least impact on the surrounding environment.

properties.Name: Skiyou Ranch
properties.description:
Skiyou Ranch is a 4th-generation family farm raising grass fed Black Angus 100% Certified Organic beef. Nestled along the beautiful Skagit River in Sedro-Woolley, Washington, our farm is dedicated to raising healthy animals in a sustainable environment for our family and yours.

We use no pesticides, herbicides, or chemicals of any kind. All our animals are hormone and antibiotic free.

We take pride in what we do and are proud to share our beef with the local community at an affordable price.

properties.Name: Skylight Farm
properties.description: Skylight Farms, situated on the banks of the beautiful Snohomish River, was started by Jonathan and Petrina Fisher in late 2012. In the search to do something meaningful, Jonathan and Petrina left their desk jobs and decided to grow the kind of food that should be on every table: sustainable, ecological, and ethical. With five acres in cultivation, Skylight Farms’ rich, sandy loam soil yields a diverse mix of vegetables, fruit, and herbs. In addition, the farm is home to a flock of pastured laying hens, a small herd of cattle, and a few bee hives.

properties.Name: Steel Wheel Farm
properties.description: Steel Wheel Farm is a small, first-generation family farm with one goal in mind: To improve the way in which produce is grown, harvested and distributed. Everything we do is guided by our mission of being quality-driven, environmentally friendly and stewards of the land. We believe that quality food begins with the farmer, and because of that, we provide only fresh, local and naturally-grown items.

properties.Name: Summer Run Farm
properties.description: Summer Run Farm is a Certified Naturally Grown farm in Carnation, Washington on the valley floor of the Snoqualmie River. A former school teacher, Cathryn grows beautiful and flavorful produce on approximately five acres of her 20-acre property and specializes in black garlic, an item that she grows and ferments herself.

properties.Name: Tractor Farm
properties.description: Tractor Farm is a 4-acre mixed variety Asian pear orchard. The trees were planted in phases and the oldest trees are about 15 years old, bordered by a sequoia tree windbreak that was planted about the same time. Erin and Dan, along with some friends, lease the farm as a side-project to their busy lives. Committed to chemical-free growing practices,  they have virtually unburied the orchard from sprawling Himalayan blackberries.

properties.Name: Tualco Valley Produce
properties.description:
Located on 20 acres in the beautiful Tualco Valley, near the Skykomish River, Tualco Valley Produce is a family-owned farm and produce stand. We believe that our community should have access to local, fresh, clean, whole food and a connection to the people and place it was grown.

The head of our family is Rosario, she has a lifetime of experience farming organically including more than 25 years on this farm. She has added to the 100 plus years of farming history of the land and loves teaching her third generation how to care for the plants and land.

properties.Name: Tuk Muk Farm
properties.description: Tuk Muk's mission is to grow an abundance of healthy and delicious vegetables and herbs—with an emphasis on unique and hard-to-find Asian varieties—alongside pasture-raised chickens and pigs. We are stewards of the land, take nurturing care of our animals and maintain happy, productive farmers. We consider our farm a laboratory and seek out creative and innovative ways to grow the best food possible.

properties.Name: Radicle Roots Farm
